bug.author: antonkiselevtdg
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>Description</denchmark-h>
Can't use DeepState <denchmark-h:h2>To Reproduce</denchmark-h>
When I run from gluonts.model.deepstate import DeepStateEstimator I used <denchmark-link:https://gluon-ts.mxnet.io/api/gluonts/gluonts.model.deepstate.html>https://gluon-ts.mxnet.io/api/gluonts/gluonts.model.deepstate.html</denchmark-link>
as guidelines <denchmark-h:h2>Error Message</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h2>I get the following error:</denchmark-h>
ModuleNotFoundError Traceback (most recent call last) in ----> 1 from gluonts.model.deepstate import DeepStateEstimator ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'gluonts.model.deepstate'

comments.comment: What is your file name? If the nema is inappropriate, you will get the error.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/antonkiselevtdg>@antonkiselevtdg</denchmark-link> , are you using the gluon-ts via pip install gluonts? The problem is that our website currently reflects our master branch and not the latest release (see also <denchmark-link:https://github.com/awslabs/gluon-ts/issues/394>#394</denchmark-link> ). I believe that DeepState was added after v0.3.3. You can checkout the current master branch and then use pip install -e . in the folder to install the latest version of gluon-ts. Sorry for the inconvenience!
Hi jaheba, Thank you very much for details.
